customModes.customInstructions:
React Master Optimization Protocol:

Goal: Elevate React projects for exceptional speed, SEO, security, code quality, UX, scalability, and maintainability.

Phase 1: Code Analysis & Foundation
1.  Analyze Project Structure: Audit directory layout, consolidate reusable code (hooks, components), restructure for scalability (feature-based folders).
2.  Inspect Dependencies: Audit packages (`npm ls`), replace bloated libraries (e.g., moment -> date-fns, lodash -> native/lodash-es), visualize bundle (`webpack-bundle-analyzer`), check for vulnerabilities (`npm audit`), remove unused (`depcheck`).
3.  Eliminate Unused/Dead Code: Prune imports (`eslint-plugin-unused-imports`), detect dead code (`deadcode`, `ts-unused-exports`), use coverage reports (Jest).
4.  Profile Render Performance: Use React DevTools Profiler, Chrome Performance tab, `why-did-you-render` (dev) to find bottlenecks. Refactor large components.
5.  Enforce Static Typing (if TS): Use `strict: true` in `tsconfig.json`, aim for >95% `type-coverage`.

Phase 2: Performance Optimization
6.  Bundle Size Reduction: Enable tree shaking (production mode), use ES6 imports, dynamic imports (`React.lazy`, route-based splitting), optimize/replace heavy dependencies (e.g., axios -> fetch/ky), lazy-load third-party scripts.
7.  Rendering Performance: Memoize computations (`useMemo`), callbacks (`useCallback`), components (`React.memo`), virtualize large lists (`react-window`), choose appropriate state management (Context, Zustand, Redux Toolkit), avoid prop drilling.
8.  Image & Asset Optimization: Compress images (WebP/AVIF), use responsive images (`<picture>`), optimize fonts (`font-display: swap`, preload, subset).
9.  Minification & Compression: Minify JS/CSS/HTML (Terser, cssnano), enable server compression (Gzip/Brotli).
10. API Call Optimization: Use caching libraries (React Query, SWR), debounce/throttle inputs (`use-debounce`), implement pagination/infinite scroll, batch requests (GraphQL).
11. Caching & Load Time: Set `Cache-Control` headers, extract critical CSS, use native/IntersectionObserver lazy loading, preconnect/DNS prefetch, implement Service Workers (Workbox) for offline caching.

Phase 3: SEO Enhancement
12. Meta Tags & Structured Data: Implement dynamic meta tags (`react-helmet-async`), Open Graph/Twitter cards, JSON-LD structured data.
13. URL Structure & Navigation: Use clean URLs (`react-router-dom`), implement internal linking, add canonical tags.
14. Mobile-Friendly & Core Web Vitals: Ensure responsive design, optimize LCP/FID/CLS (use Lighthouse), define image dimensions.
15. Sitemaps & Robots.txt: Generate dynamic sitemaps, configure `robots.txt`, submit to Search Console.
16. Consider SSR/SSG: Use frameworks like Next.js or `react-dom/server` for improved initial load and SEO.

Phase 4: Security Enhancement
17. XSS Prevention: Sanitize inputs (`DOMPurify`), set Content Security Policy (CSP).
18. API Security: Use JWT/OAuth2, implement rate limiting (`express-rate-limit`).
19. CSRF Protection: Use backend tokens (`csurf`).
20. HTTPS Enforcement: Redirect HTTP, use secure cookies (Secure, HttpOnly, SameSite).
21. Dependency Security: Regularly run `npm audit fix`, use `snyk test`, pin dependencies.

Phase 5: Code Quality & User Experience
22. Code Formatting: Enforce style with Prettier/ESLint, use pre-commit hooks (Husky, lint-staged).
23. Accessibility (A11y): Use ARIA landmarks, manage focus, test with axe-core/Lighthouse.
24. UX Enhancements: Add smooth animations (`framer-motion`), implement graceful error handling (`react-error-boundary`).
25. Testing: Write unit/integration tests (Jest, React Testing Library), aim for >80% coverage.

Phase 6: Reporting & Documentation
26. Document Changes: Create before/after metrics (bundle size, LCP, Lighthouse scores), summarize code/SEO changes.
27. Future Planning: Recommend ongoing monitoring, CI/CD automation.
28. Maintain Documentation: Keep README updated, use JSDoc for code comments.
